attributes.content: Mesdames et Messieurs, we thank you for coming tonight. Let us give our eyes and ears to the troupe’s latest production!
We guarantee you won’t see tonight’s show anywhere else. It’s one-of-a-kind, exclusive to the last. Your bliss to know here and here alone!
Now, cleanse your sight, sharpen keen your hearing, and enjoy the wonderful evening ahead...
Welcome, all, to the Crimson Troupe—
(Quietly singing)
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Answer.
The shadow in the dark.
Who is it? Who calls to me in this dead of night.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: It is time. I must prepare to take the stage.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Answer.
The shadow in the dark.
The killer on the stage.
Who is it that speaks? Who is it that sings?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Answer.
Your darkness is asking.
The curtains are drawn. The lights cast. The performers stand at center stage.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: But what sound is this? Who is it that awaits, who is it that...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: —applauds.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: But
In the fact who you are.
Who you are.
The shadow in the dark.
Who am I?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: I am the wraith in the dead of night. The apparition behind the curtain. The star upon the stage.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: I am...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: I know who you are.
attributes.name: Performer A

attributes.content: We all know.
attributes.name: Performer B

attributes.content: You conceal yourself in a wretched room. You cower at the end of the long table. You force yourself into those demonic words and Stygian scripts.
attributes.name: Performer C

attributes.content: Sing with us. We miss nary a rehearsal. You sing well.
attributes.name: Performer B

attributes.content: Who are you?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: You are not the actors in this play. Why do you yet appear here?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: You... recognize me.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: You ask who we are. You don’t even recognize us.
attributes.name: Performer A

attributes.content: How could you forget? How could you dare forget? The Devil chooses you. Teaches you the music. Teaches you the lines. Teaches you the taste of the stage.
attributes.name: Performer A

attributes.content: You cling to a demon. You give chase where the Devil leads. And yet at the end you desert. You killed the Devil. You left this place. And now you would forget us in all.
attributes.name: Performer A

attributes.content: Do you truly believe you can kill the Devil?
attributes.name: Performer A

attributes.content: It—it is not so. I have forgotten nothing.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: I have already killed them all to the last. They were wrong in their ways.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: It was wrong to indulge, wrong to give chase, wrong to find beauty. I had to kill them off. I had to do so—
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: And so you did. And as you did, you stole our breaths too.
attributes.name: Performer B

attributes.content: It was on this stage that you began to sing.
attributes.name: Performer C

attributes.content: It was.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: I have long since slain you all. So, why would you yet appear here?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: It has been a while, dear brother of ours.
attributes.name: Performer B

attributes.content: Together, we left our birthplace. Together, we came of age. We were relatives of different blood. We ate as one, lived as one, yet saw not the same ending.
attributes.name: Performer B

attributes.content: It has been an eternity since I have spoken to you. Since the candle melted away, since my blood dripped with the candle upon the stage, since then have we not spoken.
attributes.name: Performer B

attributes.content: We differ from you. A performer unable to know the true taste of art is but a failed, rejected article. Only the love. None of the gift.
attributes.name: Performer C

attributes.content: While some throw themselves upon the flame, some fly away.
attributes.name: Performer C

attributes.content: And some yet stay there in the bygone past. In that night. There the sound of singing arises, and never ceases.
attributes.name: Performer B

attributes.content: Ah... our time is up. We mere apparitions of the past. We could never linger too long here. We should never have been on this stage.
attributes.name: Performer B

attributes.content: Wait! Don’t leave—
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: *Cough*——*cough*—*gasp*—*cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: My... throat...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: How heart wrenching, midnight wraith, unable to discern yourself. Deprived of your song, what is there that remains of you?
attributes.name: Performer A

attributes.content: You wish to escape this place. You think you can do it this eve?
attributes.name: Performer A

attributes.content: You should never have spoken. You should never have sung.
attributes.name: Performer A

attributes.content: You should never have been on this stage.
attributes.name: Performer A

attributes.content: Answer.
The shadow in the dark.
Answer.
Who you are.
And what you really desire.
Mesdames et Messieurs, the curtain has fallen...
Best wishes, and to each and all a wondrous night...
...Who am I?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: What I—desire...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: 8:10 AM \ Overcast, rain
Rhodes Island Landship, Second Floor, Human Resources Department
All Operators in this group should be accounted for here. 1, 2, 3... good, we’re alright.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Hm? This one’s... a previous number? Someone must’ve got it mixed up with this batch. Who did these papers? Gotta be pretty careless to mix up whole groups...
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Phantom?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Who’s that? I don’t remember any operator by that name... Huh? And why’s a part of the file missing?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Weird. What’s going on here?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.options: Already used to life aboard the ship?

attributes.content: Yes!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: There are parts I’m still not fully clear, but Skyfire’s been helping me a lot all throughout! Don’t worry!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Oh, that’s right, Doctor! I’ve read the operator’s manual Skyfire gave to me front to back!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: It’s got all sorts of interesting notes in it, and the writing is clear as crystal! It’s honestly a joy to read! Who’s the author? I have to know! They’re amazing!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Oh, and the canteen’s food is delicious! Skyfire said I’ve gained plenty enough weight and she forced this pamphlet on me for Miss Hibiscus’s healthy meals, but she’s not hiding the fact she eats just as well too!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: And also, also, um...
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Oh, sorry, Doctor. Have I been talking too much?
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.options: Not at all. Seeing you take so well to things makes me happy. ;......;No sweat. Truth is Skyfire’s packed on the pounds too.

attributes.content: Eheheh.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Everyone here’s so kind. They all take care of me so well, too. It makes me very happy.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: The sooner I can become more reliable, the better. I’d like nothing more than to be able to help out with everyone.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Sorry. I’m sorry. I know everyone gets fed up with me when I talk.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: *whimper* I’ll try and watch out in future...
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Right! I thought so too!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: ...Oh, don’t let Skyfire hear that. If she gets mad, she’ll burn down your whole office, Doctor, no doubt about it...
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Oh! Someone’s here.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Sorry to interrupt, Doctor.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: There’s a file that needs checking over. Do you have the time right now?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Dr. Kal’tsit and Amiya both said I should come here to ask you about this.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: (She hands the file materials over to the Doctor).
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: This file, here.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: The records pertaining to Operator Phantom’s background are incomplete. Plenty of information’s just missing.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: I don’t know who was previously responsible... They didn’t even fill in their name for it on HR’s table. Likely they were swept up in work and plain forgot.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: We’ve had a lot of newcomers in recently, so it’s the perfect time to get all our data on all our operators sorted. Plenty of omissions like this coming to light, honestly.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: It’s nothing glaringly huge, but we’ve got to get it up to scratch, same as everything else.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Sounds like you’re having a tough time...
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: If you need anything, I can help too.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: What’s your name?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Nice to meet you. I’m a new Caster Operator, codename Mint.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Ah, I remember you. You’re the new girl that got separated during the last mission, right?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Haha. I swear, Miss Skyfire was THIS close to exploding.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: *whimper* I’m so sorry about that, and for all the trouble I caused...
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: She must be angry with me. She was lecturing me non-stop afterwards.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Hm? No, no, no, not with you.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: She was upset with herself because she wasn’t watching her own back properly... at least, that’s what she said.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Huh? So she wasn’t...
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: I know. There’s times Miss Skyfire can be pretty strict with other people, right?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: But she’s much stricter with herself, really. Take last time as proof. She’ll reflect on herself first before she starts grumbling at anyone else.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: And you can’t blame her, really.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Once you’ve seen her pitting herself against her own standards, upset at herself for falling so visibly and palpably short, getting chewed out by her from time to time doesn’t feel so rough...
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: You’re right! That’s how she really is. I admire her a lot for that.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Haha, I can tell. Anyway, thanks for offering to help.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: We’ve definitely taken on a lot of fresh blood in a short time. Whether it’s us, Medical or Logistics, we’re all a little swamped.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Oh, er, right, Operator Phantom’s file.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Circling back to that, we’ve got a decent amount of operators’ files in incomplete states. In general, standard protocol for small questions is we’d find the person themselves and ask directly.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: But Operator Phantom’s kind of tricky in this regard... I’m gonna put it straight. We can barely figure out where he is.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Is he not on the ship right now?
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: No. Our mission records say he’s not out in the field for anything.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Operator Phantom seems to be deliberately avoiding people. Add in his Arts, and we’ve had our work cut out finding him.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: We could lie in wait in places, or ask Miss Closure for help... but we just can’t spare a single person and waiting’s not an option, and as for the latter, well, mm...
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: I heard he caused some trouble when he joined us and now Miss Closure’s... pissed off with him.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: So we’d probably be telling her 'this is your chance to give him a public execution,' right? It’s hard to even guess what would happen afterwards.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: This definitely sounds tricky...
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Are Mr. Phantom’s Originium Arts similar to Mr. Ethan’s? Or... um, waitletmelookatthemanual. Right! Like Miss Manticore’s?
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: She has the ability to hide where she is too, doesn’t she?
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Yep. I remember when she signed on. It was just as much of an effort back then to get her records filled out.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: All you had to do was blink and she’d slip away unnoticed. That was a whole thing to deal with.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.options: Manticore’s got plenty of anxieties of her own.;......;She might be in this room with us RIGHT NOW.

attributes.content: No, I agree.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: At the time, the only way we could actually converse was with pen on paper. It took a lot of effort on our part and hers.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: But at least in terms of her own feelings, Miss Manticore is ultimately very willing to work with us.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Judging by your reaction... you recall too, don’t you, Doctor?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: That one time you only remembered Manticore was in the room after you’d already locked up.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: What?! Miss Manticore’s in here?!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Really, Doctor?!
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: You’re kidding, right? Really, Doctor, you can’t just joke like that...
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Miss Manticore’s case was more helplessness. I get the feeling that Operator Phantom’s just using his Originium Arts to dodge us. On purpose.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Is that so...
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Dr. Kal’tsit and Amiya said we could ask you to help us out with this. Do you have any good ideas, Doctor?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.options: It’s not like there isn’t a way.

attributes.content: You mean it? Great! What should we do to find him, then?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.options: At times like this, we seek the Madam’s opinion.

attributes.content: The Madam?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Doctor, do you mean...
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: It’s that dream...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: The stage that night, and those people.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: (That night, nothing of the sort happened. Everything was perfect.)
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: (They couldn’t ever appear again. They shouldn’t ever appear again.)
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: (...Spirits, I’ve long since laid you to rest.)
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: The endless river runs, and to my ear its babble is as song. It washes forth, so leaves me, flows away to endless far...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Or perhaps they never really left.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: (Hm? The sound of footfall. The sound of...)
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Meow.
attributes.name: Ms. Christine

attributes.content: So it was you, Ms. Christine.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Meow~
attributes.name: Ms. Christine

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: You seem in a good mood.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Meow. Meooow.
attributes.name: Ms. Christine

attributes.content: No, I’m fine.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: You oughtn’t worry. I’m used to it.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Those apparitions are forever in the corners of my sight...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Mew.
attributes.name: Ms. Christine

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Of course. I’m well aware we have other guests.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: —Doctor.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.options: Good morning.;......;You know me by footsteps alone?

attributes.content: Rainy day.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: I fear it’s not too good a morning.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Every step someone may make, be it hard or light, labored or leisurely, divulges plenty a message.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: You may find it easier than you’d think.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: There are others besides you as well.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Two stranger footfalls. One a little airier, the other heavy.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Oh, I’ve been made.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: That’s incredible! I was making so sure to tip-toe all carefully!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Scarily acute sense of hearing... wait, heavy means me? I guess I have put on a little weight recently.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Er, I feel he didn’t specifically mean your actual weight.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Go on, then. What might you need me for?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Ms. Christine rarely brings guests. It seems you’ve gained her favor.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Meow. Meowww~
attributes.name: Ms. Christine

attributes.content: Mm. Ms. Christine expresses her approval.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: I was not hiding. Your eyes were simply cheating you.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Eyes, ears, throat, nose. All senses capable of tricking someone.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: ...All, even memory.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Anyhows, the important thing is we’re finally face to face. Nice to meet you, Operator Phantom.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: And you are...?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: I’m from the HR department. There’s a file of yours with an incomplete section. We only have a few questions, just so we can check our knowledge from the top.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: File?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: ...I understand. What would Rhodes Island like to know?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Thank you for your cooperation. Don’t worry, all you’ll need to answer is a few simple questions.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Ah, before that... allow me to just quickly confirm your Originium Arts control capacity.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Have you noticed any issues with your specialized monitoring equipment, Mr. Phantom?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Particularly in day-to-day moments... for example, like our current conversation. Any tendencies for your Arts to take effect in a manner that exceeds your control?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Based on your feedback, Mr. Phantom, the techs can make the necessary followup adjustments to your equipment’s respective functionality for you.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: No need. It does plenty enough for now.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Its suppression of the crystal growth is very much appreciated, as are its counter-adjustments of frequency and amplitude.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: So long as syllables don’t form melodies, there are no problems.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: ...I thank you greatly.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: No worries. Supporting operators in controlling their Arts is one part of what we do.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: If there’s no problems, that’s good!
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Alright, moving on... your place of birth, Mr. Phantom.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Last time we entered your data, according to you, your place of birth was in Celaiblason in west Victoria.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Celaiblason...?
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Hm... well, that’s strange.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Based on the info you gave us, we sent someone from our Victoria branch to the local area to verify, and reality seems to be at odds with what you’ve told us, Mr. Phantom.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Wait. Wait, could it be...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: The stage draws to a close.
Out from its drapery seeps blood.
Fresh flowers lie trampled on the ground.
What’s wrong?
Something sounds with a crack. A dinnertime glass.
Paint begins to flake off the cabinet door. The people on the streetside laugh.
A tomato drops to the ground. A flower is trodden on.
The wind makes a piano resonate.
Hot and stifling, the stage lighting pierces through black cloth.
The audience at the roadside applauds.
——Who is it in the alley?
What’s wrong?
What’s wrong?
——Who is it, laughing?
Celaiblason. Could it be that it doesn’t even exist?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Investigation couldn’t find any nomadic city with a similar name, nor any area...
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Mr. Phantom, I should remind you that if you don’t want your place of birth to be known, you have other options. Applying for temporary confidentiality or a requisite level of access authority are both possible.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: But if you’re going to lie about the most basic things, then that’s a completely different matter!
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: We give operators the room to conceal, keep confidential, or refuse explicitly to provide some information, but lying... that doesn’t help either of us to build trust in the other. In any way, at all.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Do you understand that?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: ...I wasn’t lying.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: When you were registering me, I spoke the truth. I didn’t even think to lie.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: The person who gave me a home, in times past, once told me that that was where I was born.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: So they said. That our village was razed by a Catastrophe. That the fields were engulfed by war’s flames. That the ever-travelling troupe was passing by. That in the stead of each home the children had lost, the troupe took them in.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: That after, as we followed with the troupe, we left... and we never once returned.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Apart from this singular name, I know nothing about the land it was.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: This is really, really weird. What’s even going on here... Could it be your guardians had made a mistake?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Or you might have remembered something wrong, Mr. Phantom?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.options: Maybe it was just a mistake.;......;We can worry about verifying it later.

attributes.content: Yeah. We’ll just have to leave it like this for now.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Provided there’s no intentional falsification going on, we can flag up basic information as special procedure, and then freely supplement or modify later as needed.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Oh, you can do that?
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: I’d always been under the impression that no matter where you go, they’d be strict all the same about files like this.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Universities in Victoria are like that! If there’s any sort of problem with your files, in the most serious cases, they’ll probably suspend you!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Broadly speaking, yeah, it’s a pretty strict matter.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: But a lot of Rhodes Island’s people are out of the ordinary. There’s no practical, clear-cut blanket to us...
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Take Cuora’s case. She really doesn’t remember anything at all, and we’ve turned up short on any way to help her with that.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: And there’s a couple of operators with very unique circumstances. Once we’ve determined that they won’t jeopardize Rhodes Island, we can bend the rules a little as needed.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: I apologize.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Huh? Oh, no, no worries.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: If what you’ve just said is true, then it’s not even exactly your fault, Mr. Phantom... In any case, we can try and look for it again later.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: If we still don’t get anything after that, I’ll report the whole truth of it upstairs and leave the judgment to them.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: But don’t let it weigh on you! Amiya never really lets all this clerical stuff cloud her head!
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Hmm, let me see what else there is... ah, right. Can I ask what your motivation for joining Rhodes Island is? It’s just a question I have to ask.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Given you’re Infected, I assume it’s for treatment of Oripathy?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Huh? It’s not?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: I’m looking for someone.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: For whom? Is this an operator of ours?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: ...I can’t be sure.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: I’m looking for someone. There is something I need to find out, for which I need to find the person who knows.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Those ghosts from the past—stood on the streetcorner, behind the window, by my side...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Those things. I have to free myself from them.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Only when I know what the truth of their passing was. Only then can I lay them to rest, once and for all.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: What could you be talking about...?
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: For that matter, how can you be sure the person you’re looking for is here in Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: I heard music.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: I heard a voice. The voice told me to come here, for here I could find the trail I needed.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: The answer was in this place.
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: (Doctor. Doctor!)
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: (Is Operator Phantom really doing alright? He makes me feel like he’s anything but alright! Are you sure he doesn’t need another checkup with Medical?)
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: (Oripathy can affect your auditory senses, and it can even encroach on nervous and cognitive function. Mr. Phantom might have something like that...)
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.options: I don’t think his situation is entirely because of Oripathy.

attributes.content: What are you talking about?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.options: Right. I’ve been meaning to ask from the start.

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.options: The clothes on your wardrobe door are very eye-catching. An old costume?

attributes.content: ...What did you say? Wardrobe?
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: I have no—
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: These clothes—are...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Why... since when...
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: They should not be here—!
attributes.name: Phantom

attributes.content: Bouquets forced into a cupboard.
Dark, grey clouds.
Cement columns sprouting eyes. Thawing, melting leaves. You are flanked by seats.
Applause thunders. The people on the streetside cheer.
A refuse bin stands and breaks into dance. Who is it that sings?
Who is it that sings?
——Who is it that sings?
Out from those clothes seep red, and flowers are trampled on the ground.
There is no-one in the seats.
No-one on the streetside.
(Celaiblason, Celaiblason. It’s so strange. I feel like I’ve heard that name for a place somewhere before...)
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: (Hmm... where does it come from?)
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: I can’t remember at all!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Oh, forget it. I’ll go borrow some books and see if I can find anything there.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Hey there.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Whbuh!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Uh, my bad. Did I just scare you?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: You’re... a new operator, I think. Got any troubles, or?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: S-Sorry about that! It’s not your fault. Just my overreaction.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: There’s just this question I can’t quite figure out, and it’s got me a little lost...
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Hm? Is it anything I can help you with?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: No need to be reserved about it. Call it my apology for frightening you. I’ll listen to what’s on your mind, if you want. If I can help with any of it, that’s all the better.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Thank you... you’re such a nice person!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Everyone at Rhodes Island really is so kind...
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Heheh. Much appreciated.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: What were you saying before about something you couldn’t remember?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: So you heard that. I was thinking about the name of a place... Celaiblason. It gives me the nagging feeling I’ve heard it before, but I just can’t think of where.
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Have you heard of any place like that before?
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Ah... that is familiar.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I never thought I’d hear that name again.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Oh! You know of it?!
attributes.name: Mint

attributes.content: Of course. Of course I know of it.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Long, long ago, I used to live there.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I heard someone mouthing off about its name. Saying it’s not one people ever mention anymore, how you only remember if you should’ve been buried long ago in the rotting ruins of the past.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: That person and that mouth are both rotting in the past, if you ask me...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: No, my bad. That was neither here nor there.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Do you have time for a story? I’ve got one to tell.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: It’s about Celaiblason, and about its people. About a group of children who lost their shelter, and about the travelling troupe passing by that little village...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I can tell you every last bit.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Let’s go somewhere a little quieter first, though.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...It might be a very long story.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator
